data.name: 19 Original Colonies
data.description: 19 Original Colonies Mead is brewed using 5 ingredients: Rogue Hopyard Honey, Wild Flower Honey, Jasmine Silver Tip Green Tea Leaves, Champagne Yeast & Free Range Coastal Water. No Chemicals, additives or preservatives were used.

breweries.name: Rogue Ales
breweries.description: Rogue Ales was founded in 1988 by Jack Joyce, Rob Strasser and Bob Woodell, three corporate types who wanted to go into the food/beverage industry. Rogue's first brewpub was located in Ashland, Oregon and was a 10bbl brewsystem. Rogue opened a second brewpub, 15bbl brewsystem, in May 1989 located in Newport, Oregon. Rogue closed its Ashland operation in 1997, after the great flood destroyed the place. In 1991, the 15bbl system, named Howard after John Maier's former boss, from the Newport brewpub was transferred across the bay to the current brewery and upgraded to a 30bbl system. In 1998 Rogue bought a 50bbl brewsystem, named Kobe. Kobe is the only brewsystem in use. Tours: We offer brewery tours every day at 3 pm (followed by a distillery tour at 4pm). Go up to the bar inside the brewery (Brewers on the Bay) and check in with the bartender and the tour will commence. Please call ahead if you have a large group and or to verify the tour time...Brewer's on the Bay phone is 541-867-3664. The view from Brewers on the Bay includes the marina (outside), and the bottling line and brew kettles (inside).

locations.name: Rogue Ales at the Portland Airport

breweries.name: B. Nektar Meadery
breweries.description:
Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).

Through the labors of the honeybees and flora around us we transform their work into one of the oldest fermented beverages in the world. We use the finest locally sourced ingredients and pride ourselves on providing the highest quality Mead to our customers.  Taste something Crafted!

data.name: Barrel-Aged Borealis
data.description: Barrel-Aged Borealis is a limited edition mead crafted with 100% raw wildflower honey, buckwheat honey, vanilla bean, and just a touch of locally roasted coffee bean.  Aged for one year in barrels used by a local brewery for their award-winning Barrel-Aged Imperial Stout, this complex mead is not for the weak at heart.

data.name: Belgian Meadjito
data.description: Belgian Meadjito is a lime and mint hydromel. Pistils of our seasonal Belgian Meadjito are crafted with 100% raw wildflower honey, fresh crushed mint, lime juice and Belgian yeast to create our unique take on two summertime favorites from both Belgium and Cuba. This light and refreshing mead is only available for a limited time.

breweries.name: Redstone Meadery
breweries.description:
David Myers, known as 'Chairman of the Mead', founder of Redstone Meadery, is a romantic and wants to see mead once again enjoying the glory days of yesteryear. He started the Boulder, Colorado company with the 'natural philosophy' that he produce the highest quality honey wine on the market.

Because of this 'philosophy of mead', Redstone does not cork (to avoid oxidation) but instead uses swing top bottles. This ensures the mead will not breathe while cellaring plus offers a much longer shelf life once the bottle has been opened.

In keeping with the 'natural' approach, Redstone does not add any sulfites, a known allergen, as honey is it's own natural preservative. Redstone only pasteurizes the must (unfermented mead) and never boils. The company strives to feature the flavors of the fermentable as much as possible.

In 2003 Redstone Meadery brought the International Mead Festival (www.meadfest.com) to Boulder, Colorado and with that helped to establish mead as its own beverage category. Also at this time Redstone spearheaded the creation of the International Mead Association (www.meadfest.org) to help promote and educate the masses about the world's first fermented beverage.

Currently, Redstone products are distributed to 20 states across the U.S., making it the widest distributed wine from the state of Colorado and one of the most widely distributed meads in the country! From the Northwest to the Southeast, Ask for Mead!

Once only available at festivals and in our taproom, Chipotle Pollen-Nation is now coming to the masses.

breweries.name: Cigar City Brewing
breweries.description: Cigar City Brewing was founded with two goals in mind. The first to make the world's best beer and the second to share with people near and far the fascinating culture and heritage of the Cigar City of Tampa. From its past as the world's largest cigar producer to its Latin roots and the many other diverse peoples that call it home, Tampa draws on many sources to develop its unique culture. At CCB we are fascinated by Tampa's history and suspect you will be too.

data.name: Fairy Godmother
data.description: With the help of a giant magic ladle, Arktos has transformed pumpkin, cinnamon, ginger and other enchanting spices into a golden carriage steeped in honey and aged in oak. Slip on your best pair of dancing shoes and enjoy a night out on the town, arm in arm, with our Fairy Godmother Pumpkin Mead. And remember, this spell won’t break until well after the last bottle is gone.

breweries.name: Arktos Meadery
breweries.description:
For more than 9,000 years, the fermentation of honey has helped define culture and shape history. Early Slavic trading, Norse Mythology, Vedic Hymns of India, Old English Epics, 19th century Russian Literature, all of these acts or works, not to mention the contemplations of many a great mind of ancient Greece, have taken part in documenting and contributing to the continuing history of what we commonly refer to as Honey Wine or Mead making.

Arktos Meadery is now one more step in this evolutionary process. Nature has so graciously provided us with all the ingredients necessary for the production of this Nectar of the Gods. Now it is our responsibility to take these fruits, spices, and yeasts and combine them with those two wonderfully simple ingredients of honey and water for the purpose of continuing the hallowed tradition of making mead.

It is our hope and intention to provide each and every one of our mead drinkers with the finest, simplest and most natural mead possible. Oh, that sweet, sweet nectar…

breweries.name: Brothers Drake Meadery
breweries.description:
Like most things, there are various ways to make mead. At Brothers Drake, our philosophy on making mead is based on the following principles:

1. Start Local: We buy local honey, support local agriculture, and produce a local product.

2. Use the Best: We look for the highest quality local product on the market, ordering from the best from the source closest to Ohio.

3. No Heat: We do not boil our honey or any water used in production. The No Heat Method keeps honey flavors true to the source and a better mead.

4. No Added Sulfites: Unlike grapes which have wild yeast growing on them, honey is naturally antiseptic and antibiotic, so no sulfites needed.

5. Build community: We share our knowledge openly and are grateful to people everywhere who ask questions, share their perspective, and engage in an open collaborative dialogue on mead-making.

6. Embrace creativity: Our mead can be paired with wonderful cheeses, appetizers, and entrees, as well as used in cooking and in mixed drinks.

These basic principles guide our craft, our partnerships, and our practices. We look forward to sharing a drink with you!

data.name: Hopped Traditional
data.description: Traditional beer technique in combination with mead makes this the beer lover’s wine. We’ve unleashed Cascade and Chinook Hops on our local wildflower honey. The light honey gets punched up a bit with citrus & pine notes and a slightly bitter finish.  Drink by the pint and order your favorite pub fare!

breweries.name: Makana Meadery
breweries.description:
Grahamstown Brewery Pty (Ltd), trading as Makana Meadery was founded in the year 2000 with the primary objective of placing a 20 000 year old South African honey based beverage, iQhilika on the world's shelves.

Makana Meadery has its beginnings in a Rhodes University based research project to develop state of the art fermentation technology for producing iQhilika, an African mead. The meadery is housed in a historical Grahamstown landmark on the outskirts of this picturesque educational town in the Eastern Cape of South Africa.

data.name: Jinja Dragon
data.description: Spring has awoken the might of the Jinja Dragon.  We've harnessed the power of "the glow" through generous additions of hibiscus and ginger with a touch of black peppercorn.  Sure enough, the legend of the shogun of mead is true.  Although only available for a short time throughout the year, we assure you this is not the last Jinja Dragon.

breweries.name: B. Nektar Meadery
breweries.description:
Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).

data.name: Nutmeg
data.description: Nutmeg is the seed of a tropical evergreen, Myristica fragrans, native to the islands of Indonesia. Its aroma is warm, creamy and full-bodied. Paired with honey, nutmeg creates a concentrated, voluptuous mead.
data.foodPairings: Pairs beautifully with fish and roasted poultry.

data.name: Pollen-Nation
data.description: Pollinator is a dry hopped (cascades) spiced blackberry hydromel.  Pistils of Pollinator (click here to learn about Crafted Pistils)  are crafted in honor of the industrious honey bees.  Responsible for over one-third of the world's food supply they have worked thanklessly through the ages.  Threatened today by Colony Collapse Disorder and other man-made threats, the weight of the world is getting a little heavier for the honey bee.  Raise a glass to the Pollinator and click here for details on how you can help.

data.name: Snowbelt Cyser
data.description: From lake effect snow and nor'easters to snow rollers and polar vortexes, things can get a little crazy here in the snowbelt.  Tales of road crews using this spiced cranberry cyser to treat icy roads are purely urban legend.  Regardless of where you are, it's sure to give you a brief respite from the winter months with it's warming vanilla and cinnamon notes.

breweries.name: Moonlight Meadery
breweries.description:
It all started back in 1995, when Michael tried a cyser (apple and honey mead) for the first time.  Since that first sip Michael has developed a passion, and a masterful skill at making international award winning meads. Michael Fairbrother has started Moonlight Meadery™, with a mission to bring ultra premium meads to the market place.  It is more than a product and it is more than a process, it's our obsession.

"Mead to me is passion, it's about living and love, it's about enjoyment, family and friends, and sharing." says Michael Fairbrother, Founder and Mead Maker. 

Our meads will be unique, and unlike anything you have ever tried, you will find it incredible!   We are going to embrace the unique nature of natural honey as minimally processed as possible.

data.name: Vanilla Cinnamon Mead
data.description: Vanilla Cinnamon Mead is a semi-sweet mead that is crafted from 100% raw wildflower honey, water, and yeast. A trifecta of cinnamon that includes Indonesian, Ceylon, and Saigon varieties is added during aging and coupled with Madagascar vanilla beans to impart their rich, warming flavors.

breweries.name: Crafted Artisan Meadery
breweries.description: Located in rural Northeast Ohio Crafted Artisan Meadery specializes in award-winning handcrafted Mead.  Through the labors of the honeybees and flora around us we transform their work into one of the oldest fermented beverages in the world. We use the finest locally sourced ingredients and pride ourselves on providing the highest quality Mead to our customers.  Taste something Crafted!

data.name: Wild Ohio
data.description: Wild Ohio is mead in its most traditional form: simply honey, water and yeast. It’s our mission statement in a bottle. We make it in Columbus from local honey and only sell it in Columbus. We use local wildflower honey, which is minimally processed and never boiled to keep the nuanced, light flavors of the honey in the finished mead. Slightly sweet and delicate, Wild Ohio pairs well with spicy foods and makes a sensible start to a number of our signature cocktails.

style.name: Open Category Mead
style.description: This mead should exhibit the character of all of the ingredients in varying degrees, and should show a good blending or balance between the various flavor elements. Whatever ingredients are included, the result should be identifiable as a honey-based fermented beverage.

breweries.name: Brothers Drake Meadery
breweries.description:
Like most things, there are various ways to make mead. At Brothers Drake, our philosophy on making mead is based on the following principles:

1. Start Local: We buy local honey, support local agriculture, and produce a local product.

2. Use the Best: We look for the highest quality local product on the market, ordering from the best from the source closest to Ohio.

3. No Heat: We do not boil our honey or any water used in production. The No Heat Method keeps honey flavors true to the source and a better mead.

4. No Added Sulfites: Unlike grapes which have wild yeast growing on them, honey is naturally antiseptic and antibiotic, so no sulfites needed.

5. Build community: We share our knowledge openly and are grateful to people everywhere who ask questions, share their perspective, and engage in an open collaborative dialogue on mead-making.

6. Embrace creativity: Our mead can be paired with wonderful cheeses, appetizers, and entrees, as well as used in cooking and in mixed drinks.

These basic principles guide our craft, our partnerships, and our practices. We look forward to sharing a drink with you!

breweries.description: Located in Curtis Bay, Charm City Meadworks is Baltimore's first meadery. We're going to give your tastebuds something to be excited about!

data.name: Zombie Killer Cherry Cyser
data.description:
Dedicated to the freaks and the geeks! What started as a top-secret experiment with Michigan honey, cherries, and apple cider became a viral
epidemic. It won’t be easy to survive, so grab your weapons and don’t for get to stock up on these bottles for backup. Served cold...zombies hate the cold.

breweries.name: B. Nektar Meadery
breweries.description:
Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).
